No longer need a team, have someone helping me.

item.title: *Close/lock please
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote="(Anthony), post:59, topic:422582"][quote author=baddy351 link=topic=525245.msg3836458#msg3836458 date=1322943996]
No, i just restarted. My main void for my kernal was corrupted. This was due to my a tual windows 7 that I have something wrong with crashing. Thus nothing saved, much less severe then I thought.
Non the less, I am deciding to restart, on my linux OS i have on this computer. Using that i already have alot of the libs needed.
In other words, restarting not using my faulty windows. The error just came from not everything saving so i tried to emulate the OS to start it to see if it would run at all (Can’t really do anything) but then error, even though it ran. I just was wrong in something, and am restarting it.

[/quote][/quote]
i laughed out loud, gj

ps: the main method of C applications is of return type integer.

item.title: *Close/lock please
item.dc:creator: @classic mopmans little slave
item.description:
@classic wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:22, topic:422582”]How is this verbal abuse. I’m just proving a point. I haven’t said any profanity or anything harmful in anyway, unless you interpreted it that way (which wasn’t my fault as it wasn’t intended. I am going to break down your post and point out the “ROFL” parts. [quote author=baddy351 link=topic=525245.msg3826793#msg3826793 date=1322255673]
Pre algebra? Really? I am actually taking statistics right now. Stats and geometry (I am taking stats online.) [/quote]Thats cool and all about this, the thing is you don’t qualify in any way to take statistics according to the Stanford requirements in this link: http://scpd.stanford.edu/public/category/courseCategoryCertificateProfile.do?method=load&certificateId=1163094

[quote author=baddy351 link=topic=525245.msg3826793#msg3826793 date=1322255673]
Stuart you are just mad that you do not know what I am talking about.[/quote]I do know what you are talking about. I don’t ever try to be a “try-hard” by saying fancy words i found on Wikipedia.

[quote author=baddy351 link=topic=525245.msg3826793#msg3826793 date=1322255673]
And have you even looked through my posts? No.[/quote]Yes, I have.

[quote author=baddy351 link=topic=525245.msg3826793#msg3826793 date=1322255673]
For instance, algorithims are the basics of making an operating system. A backtracking Algorithim essentially finds the best path and then decides. (Guessing of sorts) combined with other things. That is how an OS works.
[/quote]Kool bro. Atleast you don’t plagerise after you read up on Wikipedia.

[quote author=baddy351 link=topic=525245.msg3826793#msg3826793 date=1322255673]
Now please stop trying to sound smart in my posts, I do not want you in my posts for there is no need for filth. I am going to report you to a moderator yet again for verbal abuse among other things. Now get out.
[/quote]So you say i verablly abuse you but you call me filth? And cool about the report as I have not broken any rules regarding this arguement. And no, I am not getting out. I have every legal right to read this thread.[/quote]
RiiPiiNFtW, Why must you flame this topic? why cant you leave and let him be? baddy is a respected member of this forum, and obviously has more brains than you will ever have, and he is only 13. now, please refrain from trolling and you can gladly fuck off now.

Read full topic

item.title: *Close/lock please
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:49, topic:422582”][quote author=_s link=topic=525245.msg3834030#msg3834030 date=1322774589]

Why do you wanna build a New Os?
Linux, Mac and Windows aren’t they enough
You won’t be able to make a creative and imaginative Os Design with great stability, a Development isn’t done alone.
Google came up with Google OS, it’s kinda new, but in my opinion it’s a failure.
The ChromeOs is just a chrome Browser that doesn’t crash, Its Rights limiting so much…
I like The Mac OS design and Stablity and software security but too much for my budget
So I have a Windows Computer.
So Goodluck, But I think theres better projects to do then Building An OS.
But whoknows, show me something great.

typically writing your own kernel is done for learning purposes, you’re rarely trying to replace an operating system that’s had thousands of hours and dollars put into it, and given a bit of snooping around at the more adventurous kernels ie. microkernels like MINIX, Hurd and L4 or proof-of-concepts like JNode and SharpOS. development can be done alone also, but it’s going to be hard slog.

as for Chrome OS, it’s a user-oriented Linux distribution that Google have modelled over the Chrome browser. what’s more to say? it’s been confined to certain hardware (Chromebooks) much like OS X is, but it doesn’t have nearly as much of a market grip. and if you’re upset about it confining you to a simple environment in which it’s hard to do anything that an average user would do, you need to remind yourself that it’s built to be simple to use for average users. if you want to fuck around, go for a different Linux distribution.

and why would you say there are better projects to do? like what? something that you want done? haha, we’re not all you and i think you’re expecting him to create the new windows/linux/mac/ when i think and hope he’s aiming lower.
[/quote]

Well, We do Hope he succeeds, and I hope he aims higher. In order to succeed you set yourself a goal.
What I am suggesting is that he shouldn’t only work by himself.
It’s hours and hours spent, and guess what I could spend years on a project and fail.
A project only succeeds if you have a heart for what you aim for.
Lets see mark zuckerberg, Yes I know he didn’t Create a OS (duhh) He created Facebook
Success, because he dreamed and he worked with many many people, a team a team with the same dreams and goals. You always aim high Not aim Lower.
have You never heard of the quote
“Miracles Happen to those who wait?”
When I say there are better projects to do I meant if you were working alone, something smaller than a Os would be better
But I didn’t say he shouldn’t. I said Good Luck, show me something Great.
I never said No No, You have no skill Just stop it.

“hobbyists are hobbyists, let them do what they want - mscp”
thats what you said when you derepped me, did I tell him to gtfo or just stop, I only made a simple suggestion, not to start a war here.
Btw, Baddy aim higher Good Luck Hope you succeed ;), (I hope nobody replies to this, only a reply to _S)[/quote]if that’s what you were trying to convey, then fair enough, i misinterpreted it. also, my derep was based upon how you said “So Goodluck, But I think theres better projects to do then Building An OS.”. you have clarified though, so just regard it as a moot -1.

Read full topic

as for Chrome OS, it’s a user-oriented Linux distribution that Google have modelled over the Chrome browser. what’s more to say? it’s been confined to certain hardware (Chromebooks) much like OS X is, but it doesn’t have nearly as much of a market grip. and if you’re upset about it confining you to a simple environment in which it’s hard to do anything that an average user would do, you need to remind yourself that it’s built to be simple to use for average users. if you want to fuck around, go for a different Linux distribution.

Well, We do Hope he succeeds, and I hope he aims higher. In order to succeed you set yourself a goal.

It’s hours and hours spent, and guess what I could spend years on a project and fail.
A project only succeeds if you have a heart for what you aim for.
Lets see mark zuckerberg, Yes I know he didn’t Create a OS (duhh) He created Facebook
Success, because he dreamed and he worked with many many people, a team a team with the same dreams and goals. You always aim high Not aim Lower.

“Miracles Happen to those who wait?”

But I didn’t say he shouldn’t. I said Good Luck, show me something Great.
I never said No No, You have no skill Just stop it.

“hobbyists are hobbyists, let them do what they want - mscp”
thats what you said when you derepped me, did I tell him to gtfo or just stop, I only made a simple suggestion, not to start a war here.
Btw, Baddy aim higher Good Luck Hope you succeed ;), (I hope nobody replies to this, only a reply to _S)

Read full topic
